alert.note: Alert for Iron (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 14 at 5:32PM EDT until May 15 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Paint River at Crystal Falls (Paint) affecting Iron County. For the Paint River...including Crystal Falls (Paint)...elevated river levels are ongoing and forecast into tonight. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM CDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Elevated river levels caused by excessive rainfall continue. * WHERE...Paint River at Crystal Falls (Paint). * WHEN...Until 1 AM CDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...At 5.5 feet, 3500 - cfs - River exceeds bankfull stage * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:10 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 5.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below action stage early Sunday morning. - Action stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued tonight around 100 AM CDT.
